titles.title: Military Pay Improvement Act of 2007

To provide an additional 0.5 percent increase in the rates of military basic pay for members of the uniformed services above the pay increase proposed by the Department of Defense so as to ensure at least a minimum pay increase of 3.5 percent for members and to further narrow the "pay gap" that exists between the military and private sector pay scales.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Armed Services.
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR H4300)
Referred to the Subcommittee on Military Personnel.

bill.summary:
4/25/2007--Introduced.
Military Pay Improvement Act of 2007 - Waives, during FY2008, the basic military pay adjustment tied to increases in the Employment Cost Index. Increases, effective January 1, 2008, such basic pay by 3.5%.
